greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of smallest parts of all partitions of n into odd parts.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2500
formula: G.f.: Sum((2*n-1)*x^(2*n-1)/Product(1-x^(2*k-1), k = n .. infinity), n = 1 .. infinity).
example: a(5)=7 because the partitions of 5 into odd parts are [5],[3,1,1] and [1,1,1,1,1] and the smallest parts add up to 5+1+1=7.
mathematica: nmax = 50; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[Sum[(2*n - 1)*x^(2*n - 1) / Product[(1 - x^(2*k - 1)), {k, n, nmax}], {n, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x]] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jul 06 2019 *)
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Feb 15 2004
